Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Arenicin-3 analog N1 (NZ17074, synthetic AMPs, UCSS1a, 2S=S)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (85.71%) toArenicin-3V=C=R: 19%, N: 14%, G: 10%.Chemical modification: two disulfide bonds: C3-C20 and C7-C16.Activity: active against Gram- bacteria E. coli CVCC195 or CVCC1515 or CICC21530 serotype O157:H7 (MIC 0.25-1.0 ug/ml), S. typhimurium ATCC14028 (MIC 0.5 ug/ml), S. enteritidis CVCC3377 (MIC 0.25 ug/ml), S. pullorum CVCC1789 or CVCC1802 (MIC 0.25 ug/ml), S. choleraesuis CVCC503 (MIC 0.5 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa CICC10419 or CICC21630 (MIC 2-4 ug/ml), Gram+ S. aureus ATCC43300 MRSA or ATCC25923 (MIC 0.5-16 ug/ml), S. suis CVCC606 (MIC 16 ug/ml), E-faecium CMCC1.2136 (MIC >16 ug/ml), B. subtilis ATCC6633 (MIC 0.25 ug/ml), L.ivanovii ATCC19119 (MIC 128 ug/ml), fungi C. albicans CGMCC2.2411 (MIC 16 ug/ml).Structure:  NMR structure.You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.
Literature Information.Author: Yang N, Liu X, Teng D, Li Z, Wang X, Mao R, Wang X, Hao Y, Wang J. 2017
Literature Information.Title: Antibacterial and detoxifying activity of NZ17074 analogues with multi-layers of selective antimicrobial actions against Escherichia coli and Salmonella enteritidis.
